# BYO Facilitator Agent

Demonstrates providing a custom x402 facilitator via `app/accepts.ts`.

**Source:** [`examples/agent-byo-facilitator`](https://github.com/AgentlyHQ/aixyz/tree/main/examples/agent-byo-facilitator)

## What It Does

A simple temperature agent that uses a custom x402 facilitator instead of the default. Shows how to override the payment verification endpoint using `app/accepts.ts`.

## Structure

```
agent-byo-facilitator/
  aixyz.config.ts       # Agent identity and payment config
  app/
    agent.ts            # ToolLoopAgent with gpt-4o-mini
    accepts.ts          # Custom facilitator configuration
    tools/
      temperature.ts    # City temperature lookup via Open-Meteo API
```

## Key Features

- **Custom facilitator** — overrides the default x402 facilitator URL
- **`app/accepts.ts` pattern** — the framework auto-detects this file
- **Open-Meteo API** — free geocoding and weather data, no API key required

## Custom Facilitator (`app/accepts.ts`)

```ts
import { HTTPFacilitatorClient } from "aixyz/accepts";

export const facilitator = new HTTPFacilitatorClient({
  url: process.env.X402_FACILITATOR_URL ?? "https://www.x402.org/facilitator",
});
```

When `app/accepts.ts` exists, the auto-generated server uses your facilitator instead of the default one. This is useful for self-hosted facilitators or custom payment verification logic.

## Configuration

```ts
const config: AixyzConfig = {
  name: "BYO Facilitator Agent",
  description: "Demonstrates providing a custom x402 facilitator via app/accepts.ts.",
  version: "0.1.0",
  x402: {
    payTo: "0x...",
    network: "eip155:84532",
  },
};
```

## Running

```bash
cd examples/agent-byo-facilitator
bun install
bun run dev
```
